extensions.name: Open edX Aspects
extensions.description_short: Official analytics stack for Open edX, delivered as a Tutor plugin that integrates ClickHouse, Superset, dbt, Ralph, and event pipelines for actionable course and learner insights.
extensions.description_long:
# Open edX Aspects

Aspects is the official, open-source analytics system for Open edX. It provides prebuilt dashboards and in‑context reports for course teams and operators, combining tracking events and course data into fast, interactive visualizations.

## Key Features
- **Dashboards for roles**: Course, Individual Learner, At‑Risk Learners, Operator, and Course Comparison reports, plus in‑context panels in the LMS/Studio.
- **Event-to-insight pipeline**: Transforms Open edX tracking logs and xAPI events into a ClickHouse reporting schema, modeled with dbt and visualized in Superset.
- **Tutor-first deployment**: Distributed as a Tutor plugin with batteries‑included configs.
- **Privacy-aware defaults**: Learner-identifying views are off by default and can be enabled via configuration.

## Architecture Components
- **ClickHouse** (analytics database)
- **Apache Superset** (dashboards & exploration)
- **dbt** (transformations; `aspects-dbt` project)
- **Ralph** (LRS for xAPI statements)
- **Vector** & **Event Routing Backends** (capture/forward events from LMS to LRS/ClickHouse)
- **Platform Plugin Aspects** (embeds Superset dashboards back into the LMS/Studio)

## Use Cases
- Monitor enrollments, activity, and completion
- Identify at‑risk learners and content needing improvement
- Track platform health and usage at the operator level

## Technical Requirements
- **Tutor 15.0.0+**
- Open edX **Redwood or later** (Aspects v2.x)
extensions.install_notes:
# Installation (Tutor)

1. **Install & enable plugin**
```bash
pip install tutor-contrib-aspects
 tutor plugins enable aspects
 tutor config save
```
2. **Build images & init**
```bash
# Build images (include MFEs if using in-context metrics)
tutor images build openedx --no-cache
 tutor images build mfe --no-cache
 tutor images build aspects aspects-superset
 tutor local do init
```
3. **(Optional) Import or generate demo data**
```bash
# Import Superset assets and/or generate test data
tutor local do import-assets
 tutor local do load-xapi-test-data
```
4. **Access**: Superset URL and credentials are provided by Tutor after init; in‑context dashboards appear in LMS/Studio when the platform plugin is enabled.

extensions.name: Open edX Credential Service
extensions.description_short: Microservice that issues and manages Open edX course and program certificates, with a Learner Record UI and optional W3C verifiable credentials.
extensions.description_long:
# Open edX Credential Service

A standalone service (IDA) that stores, issues, and presents learner credentials for Open edX deployments. It supports **course certificates**, **program certificates**, a **Learner Record** UI (MFE), and optional **W3C verifiable credentials** generation.

## Key Features
- **Course & Program Certificates**: Define certificate configurations, signatories, and branding in Django Admin.
- **Learner Record UI (MFE)**: Public/ sharable records for earned credentials.
- **Platform Integration**: Communicates with LMS and other services via JWT service user.
- **Verifiable Credentials (optional)**: Emit machine-verifiable credentials derived from achievements.

## Architecture Components
- **Credentials IDA** (Django) with theming support
- **Learner Record MFE** for end-user views
- Integration with **LMS** and (optionally) **Discovery** for programs/catalog

## Use Cases
- Issue printable/shareable certificates for courses and programs
- Provide learners with a consolidated, shareable record of achievements
- Enable verifiable credentials workflows

## Technical Requirements
- Deployed standalone (Docker/Tutor) alongside LMS
- JWT-backed service user for cross-service API calls
- For programs, use Discovery (or equivalent) as catalog source
extensions.install_notes:
# Installation (Tutor)

1) Install & enable plugins
```bash
pip install tutor-credentials
# (For programs) also enable Discovery
tutor plugins enable discovery mfe credentials
```

2) Launch / upgrade
```bash
tutor local launch
```

3) (Optional) Copy program data from Discovery into Credentials
```bash
tutor local run credentials ./manage.py copy_catalog
```

4) Access admin & Learner Record UI
- Credentials admin: `https://credentials.<your-domain>/admin`
- Learner Record MFE is enabled by default; link from learner profile.

extensions.name: EOX core
extensions.description_short: EOX-core (A.K.A. eduNEXT Open extensions) is an open edX plugin that adds multiple API endpoints in order to extend the functionality of the Open edX platform and avoid changing the base code directly…
extensions.description_long:
# EOX core

EOX-core (A.K.A. eduNEXT Open extensions) is an open edX plugin that adds multiple API endpoints in order to extend the functionality of the Open edX platform and avoid changing the base code directly. These API endpoints includes bulk creation of pre-activated users (for example, skip sending an activation email) and enrollments.

extensions.name: course template builder
extensions.description_short: This web page generates edX course structures in a tarball file that can be immediately imported to edX Studio. You fill out the form to describe your course, selecting things like the number of secti…
extensions.description_long:
# course template builder

This web page generates edX course structures in a tarball file that can be immediately imported to edX Studio. You fill out the form to describe your course, selecting things like the number of sections, whether they focus on video/text/problems, whether the first/last pages are different, etc. The course comes wrapped in a boilerplate course with standard intro and wrap-up materials.

extensions.name: Advanced WordPress and Woocommerce Integration
extensions.description_short: Edunext WordPress and WooCommerce integration allows users to sell their courses and digital content on their WordPress website using the WooCommerce shopping cart plugin. This integration will enable…
extensions.description_long:
# Advanced WordPress and Woocommerce Integration

Edunext WordPress and WooCommerce integration allows users to sell their courses and digital content on their WordPress website using the WooCommerce shopping cart plugin. This integration will enable users to create a comprehensive and secure e-learning website with easy to use learning management tools and payment processing capabilities. It is the perfect solution for online educators looking to grow their business and reach more students quickly and easily.

extensions.name: WP Open edX integrator
extensions.description_short: A Plugin that integrates the Open edX platform with WordPress.This plugin allows to: -Share the user session information between Open edX and WordPress -Add an Open edX user menu to the WordPress navi…
extensions.description_long:
# WP Open edX integrator

A Plugin that integrates the Open edX platform with WordPress.This plugin allows to: -Share the user session information between Open edX and WordPress  -Add an Open edX user menu to the WordPress navigation structure  -Add Course buttons to the WordPress Posts or Pages that represent each course with the corresponding action and caption based on the Open edX course settings  -Integrate Woocommerce as the e-commerce solution to sale access to open edX courses -Make use of the EOX-core API that extends the functionality of Open edX.

extensions.name: Open edX Commerce (WordPress Plugin)
extensions.description_short: The Open edX Commerce package is a free and open-source WordPress plugin that allows you to integrate WooCommerce with your Open edX platform. What does this mean? You can create Open edX courses as p…
extensions.description_long:
# Open edX Commerce (WordPress Plugin)

The Open edX Commerce package is a free and open-source WordPress plugin that allows you to integrate WooCommerce with your Open edX platform. What does this mean? You can create Open edX courses as products in WooCommerce, and when you perform purchase or refund operations for these products, your Open edX platform will reflect these changes.

extensions.name: Mind Map XBlock
extensions.description_short: Mind Map XBlock is a pluggable extension to the Open edX platform that allows course creators to build a learning experience in which students can visualize and easily edit Mind Maps within a course u…
extensions.description_long:
# Mind Map XBlock

Mind Map XBlock is a pluggable extension to the Open edX platform that allows course creators to build a learning experience in which students can visualize and easily edit Mind Maps within a course unit. It leverages the jsMind open source JavaScript library to visualize and edit mind maps on htmls canvas and svg.The Mind Map Xblock component can be used to build and display a mind map for learners to explore a particular concept, or to have learners build their own Mind map which can then be graded by course staff members.

extensions.name: xqueue
extensions.description_short: XQueue defines an interface for the LMS to communicate with external grader services. For example, when a student submits a problem in the LMS, it gets sent to the XQueue. The XQueue then has the prob…
extensions.description_long:
# xqueue

XQueue defines an interface for the LMS to communicate with external grader services. For example, when a student submits a problem in the LMS, it gets sent to the XQueue. The XQueue then has the problem graded by an external service and sends the response back to the LMS.

extensions.name: ChatGPT Xblock
extensions.description_short: The ChatGPT XBlock is integrated as a component into Open edX® online courses at the unit level, so learners can access it directly from the course interface. A learner simply inputs a question and cl…
extensions.description_long:
# ChatGPT Xblock

The ChatGPT XBlock is integrated as a component into Open edX® online courses at the unit level, so learners can access it directly from the course interface. A learner simply inputs a question and clicks the Submit button. ChatGPT will then analyze the question and provide a response based on its understanding of the topic, and as it’s powered by AI it can provide answers to a wide range of questions, from simple queries to complex problems. One of the key benefits of the ChatGPT XBlock is that it can be trained to focus only on the course subject. In other words, ChatGPT will only answer questions related to the course topic, ensuring that students receive accurate and relevant information. The component can be inserted multiple times across the course in different units, with each component being provided a unique context so that it provides answers in said context.

## Links
- **Product**: , docs_link:

An XBlock that implements sorting problem. Learners have to sort items by dragging them at their correct position. Authors can define items and their correct order from studio. This Xblock also supports grading.

extensions.name: Know Wonder Learn
extensions.description_short: This XBlock enables learners to organize their thoughts and expectations before starting a course. Specifically, learners can use this component to identify what they already know about the course con…
extensions.description_long:
# Know Wonder Learn

This XBlock enables learners to organize their thoughts and expectations before starting a course. Specifically, learners can use this component to identify what they already know about the course content, as well as what they are curious to learn. Once the course is completed, learners can revisit their initial thoughts and assess what they actually learned. They can then move each point into a third category called Learned which showcases the knowledge they gained through the course.

## Links
- **Docs**: https://github.com/edly-io/kwl-xblock
- **Product**: https://github.com/edly-io/kwl-xblock

extensions.name: Feedback Xblock
extensions.description_short: The FeedbackXBlock encourages learners to reflect on their learning experiences and allows instructors to capture feedback from learners. Feedback is provided as sentiment on a predefined scale and fr…
extensions.description_long:
# Feedback Xblock

The FeedbackXBlock encourages learners to reflect on their learning experiences and allows instructors to capture feedback from learners. Feedback is provided as sentiment on a predefined scale and free text feedback. Feedback can be aggregated by instructors to understand which parts of a course work well and which parts work poorly.

extensions.name: Limesurvey Xblock
extensions.description_short: LimeSurvey XBlock allows a better integration between the Open edX platform and the Open source LimeSurvey service. Once the LimeSurvey component has been added and configured into a course unit, lear…
extensions.description_long:
# Limesurvey Xblock

LimeSurvey XBlock allows a better integration between the Open edX platform and the Open source LimeSurvey service. Once the LimeSurvey component has been added and configured into a course unit, learners can view and complete the different surveys assigned to them. NOTE: This XBlock doesn't deploy the LimeSurvey service. It requires an external service or a service installed from the Tutor stack. If you want to install a brand new LimeSurvey service using Tutor, you can use the LimeSurvey Plugin

extensions.name: Annoto
extensions.description_short: Annoto is an in-video collaboration solution that turns static, 1-way video Stream/VOD into an active and interactive group experience, where participants contribute, share and learn together. Users c…
extensions.description_long:
# Annoto

Annoto is an in-video collaboration solution that turns static, 1-way video Stream/VOD into an active and interactive group experience, where participants contribute, share and learn together. Users can lean forward and become participants and not just passive and lonely viewers, causing all users to be actively involved and return to the video content, sharing more ideas and creating more meaningful content. Resulting in higher engagement and retention, supported by comprehensive analytics and insights, that facilitate dramatic improvements to content, communications, and measurable outcomes.

Instruqt is a hands-on virtual IT Lab Platform for interactive learning. Virtual IT labs provide learners with hands-on sandbox environments. Learners can use the platform to learn about products and technology.Instruqt XBlock allows Open edX users to embed Instruqt tracks inside an Open edX course. It provides ability to track learner progress and reflects track completion in Open edX.
